# Introduction to Robotics

This chapter introduces the fundamental concepts of robotics.

## Mathematical Representation

Robotics involves a lot of math. For example, the transformation matrix $T$ can be represented as:

$$
T = \begin{bmatrix}
R & p \\
0 & 1
\end{bmatrix}
$$

where $R \in SO(3)$ is a rotation matrix and $p \in \mathbb{R}^3$ is a position vector.

## Python Example

We can use Python to perform calculations:

```{python}
import numpy as np

# Define a 3x3 identity matrix
R = np.eye(3)
p = np.array([1, 2, 3]).reshape(3, 1)

# Construct transformation matrix
T = np.block([
    [R, p],
    [np.zeros((1, 3)), 1]
])

print("Transformation Matrix T:")
print(T)
```
